org.smtlib.sexpr

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smtlib.sexpr.Lexer
      • org.smtlib.sexpr.Parser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParser

    public class Parser
extends Lexer
implements IParser
    Parses the standard SMT-LIB concrete syntax to produce ASTs of objects that are instances of the org.smtlib.* interfaces.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.smtlib.sexpr.Lexer

        Lexer.IPLexToken, Lexer.LexToken

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.smtlib.IParser

        IParser.AbortParseException, IParser.IFactory, IParser.ParserException, IParser.SyntaxException

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      IExpr.ISymbol commandName
      This field is used only to communicate the position of the name of a command to the command creator (instead of using method arguments).
      protected IExpr.IFactory factory
      The (common) factory used to generate objects
      IResponse.IError lastError
      The most recent error, or null
      ILexToken savedlp
      This field is used to communicate the beginning LP while parsing commands
      private SMT.Configuration smtConfig
      A handle to the parent SMTConfig object, in order to see command-line options etc.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Parser(SMT.Configuration smtConfig, ISource src)
      Creates a Parser using an SMT configuration object and a source for characters; ordinarily use a factory to obtain a parser.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkNoArg()
      A helper check, called by command-specific parse methods in which the commands have no arguments
      void error(java.lang.String msg, ILexToken token)
      Emits an error message consisting of the given message string with any '#' character in the string replaced by the kind() of the second argument; the position of the error is the position of the given token.
      IResponse.IError error(java.lang.String msg, IPos pos)
      Emits an error message consisting of the given message string and position.
      IResponse.IError lastError()
      Returns the most recent error, or null
      private IExpr.IAsIdentifier parseAsIdentifierRest(ILexToken lp)
      Parses an 'as' identifier, presuming the left-paren and the 'as' are already parsed, from the token stream, returning null (with logged error messages) if there is not one.
      IExpr.IAttribute<?> parseAttribute()
      Parse an attribute (keyword with optional value), returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      java.util.List<IExpr.IAttribute<?>> parseAttributeSequence()
      Parse a sequence of attributes (keyword with optional value) terminated by a right parenthesis, returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      IExpr.IAttributeValue parseAttributeValue()
      Parse an attribute (keyword with optional value), returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      IExpr.IBinaryLiteral parseBinary()
      Parses a binary literal, returning null with the given message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a binary literal, the token is not consumed,
      IExpr.IBinding parseBinding()
      Parses a binding "(id expression)", returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      java.util.List<IExpr.IBinding> parseBindings()
      Parses a parenthesized sequence of let-bindings, returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      Command parseCommand()
      Parses the next text in the source as a SMT-LIB command; if an error occurs, the error is logged and the method skips through a matching number of right parentheses
      IExpr.IDecimal parseDecimal()
      Parses a decimal, returning null with the given message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a decimal, the token is not consumed,
      IExpr.IDeclaration parseDeclaration()
      Parses a declaration "(id sort)", returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      java.util.List<IExpr.IDeclaration> parseDeclarations()
      Parses a parenthesized sequence of IDeclaration items, returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      IExpr parseExpr()
      Parses an expression, returning null with error messages if there is not a valid expression in the token stream.
      IExpr.IHexLiteral parseHex()
      Parses a hex literal, returning null with the given message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a hex literal, the token is not consumed,
      IExpr.IIdentifier parseIdentifier()
      Parses an identifier (either symbol or parameterized identifier) from the token stream, returning null with logged error messages if there is not one.
      private IExpr.IIdentifier parseIdentifierRest(ILexToken lp)
      Parses a parameterized identifier from the token stream, presuming the left parenthesis and the underscore character are already read, return null with logged error messages if there is not one.
      SMTExpr.Keyword parseKeyword()
      Parses a keyword, returning null with an error message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a keyword, the token is not consumed.
      SMTExpr.Keyword parseKeyword(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a keyword, returning null with messages if an error occurs.
      IExpr.ILiteral parseLiteral()
      Parses a literal, returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      ILogic parseLogic()
      Parses a logic definition (including beginning and ending parentheses, returning null with error messages if it fails; only part of the checking of the contents is performed in this call (the rest is done in loadLogic).
      ILexToken parseLP()
      Parses a left parenthesis, returning null and emitting an error message if there isn't one (and the next token is not consumed)
      IExpr.INumeral parseNumeral()
      Parses a numeral, returning null with error messages if an error occurs; if the next token is not a numeral, the token is not consumed,
      SMTExpr.Numeral parseNumeral(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a numeral, returning null with the given message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a numeral, the token is not consumed,
      IExpr.IQualifiedIdentifier parseQualifiedIdentifier()
      Parses a qualified identifier (either a symbol, a parameterized identifier, or an as identifier) from the token stream, returning null (with logged error messages) if there is not one.
      IResponse parseResponse(java.lang.String response) 
      ILexToken parseRP()
      Parses a right parenthesis, returning null and emitting an error message if there isn't one (and the next token is not consumed)
      ILexToken parseRP(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a right parenthesis, returning null and emitting an error message if there isn't one (and the next token is not consumed); the error message is the argument, with any '# character replaced by the kind() of the actual next token.
      ICommand.IScript parseScript()
      Parses an SMT-LIB command script.
      Sexpr.Seq parseSeq(ILexToken lp)
      Parses and adds Sexpr to a list until parseSexpr returns null (indicating a RightParen has been seen or end of input or an error)
      Sexpr parseSexpr()
      Parses an Sexpr
      Sort parseSort(java.util.List<ISort.IParameter> parameters)
      Parses a sort, returning null with error messages if a valid sort is not in the next parser tokens.
      java.util.List<ISort> parseSortList(java.util.List<ISort.IParameter> parameters)
      Parses sequence of sorts up to a right-parenthesis, returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      SMTExpr.StringLiteral parseStringLiteral()
      Parses a string literal, returning null with an error message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a string literal, the token is not consumed,
      SMTExpr.Symbol parseSymbol()
      Parses a symbol, returning null with messages and not advancing the parser if an error occurs
      SMTExpr.Symbol parseSymbol(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a symbol (but not a reserved word unless the configuration field 'relax' is true), returning null with messages if an error occurs; the parser is advanced only if an actual symbol is parsed.
      SMTExpr.Symbol parseSymbolOrReservedWord(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a symbol or a reserved word, returning null with messages if an error occurs.
      ITheory parseTheory()
      Parses a theory definition (including beginning and ending parentheses, returning null with error messages if it fails; only part of the checking of the contents is performed in this call (the rest is done in loadTheory).
      IPos pos(int start, int end)
      Returns an IPos object for the given character start and end positions and including a reference to the parser's source object.
      IPos pos(IPos start, IPos end)
      Returns an IPos object for the given character start and end positions and including a reference to the parser's source object.
      SMT.Configuration smt()
      Returns a handle to the parent SMTConfig object, in order to see command-line options etc.

      • pos

        public IPos pos(IPos start,
       IPos end)
        Returns an IPos object for the given character start and end positions and including a reference to the parser's source object.
        Parameters:
        start - the start character position (counting from 0)
        end - the end character position (one past the last actual character to be included)
        Returns:
        the IPos object representing the character range within the parser's current source

      • pos

       int end)

        Overrides:

        end - the end character position (one past the last actual character to be included)
        Returns:
        the IPos object representing the character range within the parser's current source

      • parseScript

        public ICommand.IScript parseScript()
        Description copied from interface: IParser
        Parses an SMT-LIB command script. The result is either a string literal or a parenthesized list of commands (which are parenthesized themselves); the string literal denotes the name of a file from which the commands are read when the command is executed; if the script is included directly, it is parsed, but typechecking is performed in context upon execution. If any errors occur, messages are logged and null is returned, with the parser advancing through a matching right parenthesis.
        Specified by:
        parseScript in interface IParser
        Returns:
        the parsed script

      • parseCommand

        public Command parseCommand()
        Parses the next text in the source as a SMT-LIB command; if an error occurs, the error is logged and the method skips through a matching number of right parentheses
        Specified by:
        parseCommand in interface IParser
        Returns:
        returns the parsed command, or EOD.eod if the end of input has been reached, or null if no valid command could be parsed

      • checkNoArg

        public boolean checkNoArg()
        A helper check, called by command-specific parse methods in which the commands have no arguments

      • parseSexpr

        public Sexpr parseSexpr()
                 throws IParser.ParserException
        Parses an Sexpr
        Returns:
        an Sexpr or null if no more input
        Throws:
        ParserException - if a parsing problem occurred, such as an invalid token or mismatched parentheses
        IParser.ParserException

      • parseSeq

        public Sexpr.Seq parseSeq(ILexToken lp)
                   throws IParser.ParserException
        Parses and adds Sexpr to a list until parseSexpr returns null (indicating a RightParen has been seen or end of input or an error)
        Returns:
        a SExpr.Seq containing the sequence of SExpr seen
        Throws:
        ParserException - FIXME - no more of these?
        IParser.ParserException

      • parseSymbol

        public SMTExpr.Symbol parseSymbol()

      • parseSymbol

        public SMTExpr.Symbol parseSymbol(java.lang.String msg)
                           throws IParser.ParserException
        Parses a symbol (but not a reserved word unless the configuration field 'relax' is true), returning null with messages if an error occurs; the parser is advanced only if an actual symbol is parsed. The error message is given by the argument; it may contain a '#' character that will be replaced by the kind() of the token actually observed; if the argument is null, no error message is emitted.
        Throws:
        IParser.ParserException

      • parseSymbolOrReservedWord

        public SMTExpr.Symbol parseSymbolOrReservedWord(java.lang.String msg)
                                         throws IParser.ParserException
        Parses a symbol or a reserved word, returning null with messages if an error occurs. The error message is given by the argument; it may contain a '#' character that will be replaced by the kind() of the token actually observed.
        Throws:
        IParser.ParserException

        public SMTExpr.Keyword parseKeyword(java.lang.String msg)
                             throws IParser.ParserException
        Parses a keyword, returning null with messages if an error occurs. The error message is given by the argument; it may contain a '#' character that will be replaced by the kind() of the token actually observed; if the next token is not a keyword, the token is not consumed.

        IParser.ParserException

      • parseRP

        public ILexToken parseRP(java.lang.String msg)
                  throws IParser.ParserException
        Parses a right parenthesis, returning null and emitting an error message if there isn't one (and the next token is not consumed); the error message is the argument, with any '# character replaced by the kind() of the actual next token.
        Throws:
        IParser.ParserException

      • error

        public IResponse.IError error(java.lang.String msg,
                     IPos pos)
        Emits an error message consisting of the given message string and position.

      • error

        public void error(java.lang.String msg,
         ILexToken token)
        Emits an error message consisting of the given message string with any '#' character in the string replaced by the kind() of the second argument; the position of the error is the position of the given token.
